executive_summary: The Juice Production industry has catered to health-conscious individuals who have steadily drifted away from drinks high in calories, sugar and additives. As the healthiness of Americans' diets has increased, consumers have sought new ways to satisfy daily nutritional goals. However, an influx of new drinks, like sports and energy drinks, also known as functional drinks, has also been successful in marketing to a younger demographic, creating heavy external competition for juice producers.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Consumer Demand is Challenged by High Sugar Content of Juice
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Consumers have become increasingly skeptical of juice as a health beverage. This belief has been supported by government studies and various medical and nutritional journals.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Playing to Juice's Strengths, Companies Turn to Innovation
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Despite the well-documented health concerns about juice, powerful heat waves and an intense flu season help counterbalance decreasing juice sales.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Consumer Economic Health Has Supported Growth, Despite Global Turbulence
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: When the weather is warm, consumers tend to buy more beverages. Through the flu season, sales of juice products marketed for their vitamin content increase as consumers attempt to prevent and combat illness.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Premium juice varieties spurred by demand for innovative products command higher price tags.
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Juice producers have benefited from higher per capita disposable income levers, allowing consumers to spend more lavishly on new products.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Agricultural prices have also been heightened by citrus greening in Florida
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Citrus greening, a bacterial disease that weakens a citrus tree, chokes off nutrients and causes small, preharvest fruit to drop prematurely. As a result, the supply of oranges has been pressured, translating into higher prices for consumers.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Juice Producers Will Continue to Grapple With Changing Preferences and Greater Competition
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Consumers are expected to continue to adopt healthier diets and opt to consume other calorie-free beverages, like water. New drinks will enter the beverage industry rapidly, raising competition for juice producers.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: International Brands Will Cross Borders, Posing Risks and Opportunities
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: While many US brands are available abroad and vice versa, international trade is moderated because beverages are heavy and expensive to transport, and many establishments target their local markets.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Juice Producers Will Seek to Counteract Challenges
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The industry will continue to face pressure from consumer health concerns, and increasingly, the threat of regulation. A Consumer Reports investigation found that apple juice and grape juice contain arsenic levels above those permitted in the more heavily regulated bottled water industry.
The digital avenue is now being valued for reaching out to niche audiences, like juice aficionados, and for fostering brand loyalty.

industry_definition: This industry manufactures fruit and vegetable juices. It excludes carbonated soda producers, independent bottlers and ice makers as well as producers of functional (sports and energy) drinks, ready-to-drink tea and coffee and flavored water.

threats: Low Performance Drivers - Per capita fruit and vegetable consumption

key_trends: Health trends have hampered demand for juice. Health-conscious consumers are concerned about the high sugar content of juice.
Juice producers have looked to new products to attract consumers. Large companies have introduced new juice varieties and purchased smaller competitors to gain access to niche product segments.
Tariffs have helped dampen import penetration. A range of levies exist on juices including unfermented orange juice, grapefruit juice and other citrus juices, as well as vegetable juices.
Compliance with federal guidelines is paramount, including labeling requirements and environmental regulations. The FDA and EPA monitor food and environmental standards compliance.
Orange juice and lemonade are stalwarts of the industry. These products remain the most popular, despite the introduction of new products.
Grocery stores and supermarkets remain the favored retail channel for fruit juices. Sales of juices through these retail channels increased during the pandemic.
Areas with access to access to agricultural inputs are popular for producers. Both California and Florida have many companies.
Companies mitigate price-based competition by establishing brand loyalty. Consumers are willing to pay higher prices for their favorite products.
Import penetration into the industry has risen. Juices manufactured overseas pose a challenge because they are typically sold at lower prices.
The industry's largest companies are large, multinational corporations. In addition to juices, they produce a variety of other beverages and can leverage scale to reduce per-unit costs.

Many small- and medium-sized companies have thrived in the industry, despite the existence of consolidated drink producers. The wide range of product offerings and diverse consumer tastes create opportunities for upstart players to target niche consumer segments.
Despite volatile input costs, profitability is buoyed by larger companies. Major producers operate at scale, allowing them to lower per-unit costs.
Purchases are the largest cost category for juice producers. To limit exposure to input volatility, companies enter long-term contracts.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Grocery stores and supermarkets are reliable sources of sales for fruit and vegetable juice manufacturers and are the most important retail channels for consumers. Households regularly frequent these establishments to purchase food and drink, including juice. Spending at grocery stores and supermarkets has risen amid rising disposable income, allowing consumers to relax budget constraints and spend more on discretionary purchases amid rising disposable income.

Warehouse clubs and supercenters have grown in popularity over the past decade as these outlets offer consumers greater purchasing power by selling items in bulk. Major retailers in this channel, like Walmart, have allocated more space to food and beverages in their stores. One downfall, however, is that industry products typically do not have a long shelf life compared with other drinks, like sodas, posing a threat to juice producers.

Gas stations and convenience stores constitute a key market for drink manufacturers, especially because they are often open 24 hours a day and maintain a high sales volume. Convenience stores and gas stations provide producers with retail space to market beverages that depend heavily on impulse buyers, like people on a lunch break or seeking refreshments while traveling. The COVID-19 pandemic resulted in a sharp fluctuation in purchases at convenience stores and gas stations, as individuals drove less while economic restrictions remained.

Vending machines and individual vendors are convenient outlets for consumers in locations like rail and bus stations where no alternative vendors exist. Other popular locations for vending machines include recreation centers, sports complexes and academic campuses.
Other markets include drug stores, community centers, private clubs, hotels, hospitals and schools, which do not usually sell many this industry's products.

products_and_services.product_description: Citrus juices like orange juice and lemonade are the most popular product segment. Even as consumers have been eager to try new drinks that have come to market, demand for lemonade has increased as consumers replace sugar soft drinks during lunch and dinner with more natural beverages.

Smoothies have been particularly popular recently, as have blended fruit juices. However, the increased focus on childhood obesity and sugar intake levels has negatively affected this segment, which contains whole juice with high sugar content from natural fructose.

The rising price of citrus fruit juices has encouraged increasingly health-conscious consumers to further explore alternatives, shifting preferences to exotic non-citrus drinks as a substitute for soft drinks. However, the increased focus on childhood obesity and sugar intake levels has negatively affected this segment, which contains whole juice with high sugar content from natural fructose. The popularity of tropical fruit juices has helped offset the negative pull from high-sugar fruit juices.

The vegetable juice segment includes green juices made with spinach, kale, parsley, romaine, cucumber and celery, often combined with fruit to sweeten the taste. The high level of nutrients and antioxidants in vegetable juices has led to greater consumer interest alongside rising health consciousness, enabling this segment to secure a strong and growing niche.
Other juices include apple juice, tomato juice, pineapple juice and cider. The remainder is composed of a mixture of other berry juices.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Per Capita Fruit and Vegetable Consumption
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Fruits and vegetables are the main ingredients in Juice Production industry products. As consumers eat more fruits and vegetables, they are more likely to buy industry products and consume their daily fruit and vegetable intake through juice. Decreases in per capita fruit and vegetable consumption pose a potential threat to the industry.

When consumers have larger budgets due to an increase in per capita disposable income, they are more likely to make purchases beyond basic needs. This financial freedom typically leads to demand for discretionary products such as functional or juice drinks. Therefore, a rise in disposable income directly leads to increased industry demand as consumers venture into more luxury or non-essential purchases, benefiting manufacturers and retailers of these products.

The Healthy Eating Index measures diet quality, reflecting how well individuals align with federal dietary guidelines. Following this, a surge in health consciousness could potentially present beneficial scenarios for products within the low-sugar industry. This heightened awareness leading to gains in the index suggests an untapped opportunity for the industry.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Imports Continue to Rise, Despite the Pandemic
international_trade_points.trade_description: Rising interest in exotic beverages, coupled with growth in disposable income, has lifted imports. Indicative of this, imports from Switzerland and Austria, both high-income countries with expensive labor costs, account for about a third of total imports.

international_trade_points.trade_title: A Strong Dollar Boosts Imports Even as Global Volatility Persists
international_trade_points.trade_description: The US dollar has strengthened in recent years, as exemplified by a strong showing in the trade-weighted index. The strong dollar has encouraged domestic producers to import more goods due to the currency's relative strength.

international_trade_points.trade_title: THE MARKET FOR DOMESTICALLY PRODUCED JUICE IS LIMITED
international_trade_points.trade_description: The rising dollar has placed significant pressure on exports, which are already limited because of the high costs associated with American-made products. Most exports are intended for regional neighbors, with Canada alone accounting for more than 50.0% of all exports.

international_trade_points.trade_title: MAXIMIZING SUCCESS THROUGH INNOVATIVE LOGISTICS STRATEGIES
international_trade_points.trade_description: - Leveraging strategic locations near significant ports for effortless and fast export logistics. - Employing advanced supply chain technologies to guarantee product freshness for customer satisfaction. - Partnering with highly efficient shipping partners to boost shipment speed and distribution efficiency.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region has the highest percentage of juice producer establishments at around 35%, while its population percentage is around 20%. This indicates a concentration of juice producers in the Southeast region.
The West region has the second-highest percentage of juice producer establishments at around 25%, while its population percentage is around 15%.
The Plains region has the lowest percentage of juice producer establishments at around 5%, while its population percentage is around 15%.

The population distribution impacts juice producers' location choices, as products are heavy and locating near end-markets reduces transportation costs. There are many production plants in the Southwest.

The population distribution impacts juice producers' location choices, as products are heavy and locating near end-markets reduces transportation costs. There are many production plants in the Great Lakes region.

The population distribution impacts juice producers' location choices, as products are heavy and locating near end-markets reduces transportation costs. There are many production plants in the Mid-Atlantic region.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The FDA passed the Federal Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act and the Fair Packaging and Labeling Act of 1967 which governs juice producers' production and labeling processes. The labeling requirements established by this act relate to unfair and deceptive packaging or labeling and statements of quantity. The Food Safety Modernization Act, signed into law in January 2011, shifted the focus away from responding to contamination to preventing it.

Juices must also meet the purity and safety requirements established by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA). When the EPA adds or amends a contaminant standard, the FDA also must adopt that standard for juices.

A sales tax applies to drinks in most states, which are implemented to discourage consumers from drinking an excessive volume of sugary drinks. Several states, including Colorado, Illinois, California, Pennsylvania and Washington, have implemented taxes. Due to escalating concerns regarding the safety of beverages that are targeted to teens and children, government officials have proposed legislation to curb consumption.

The growing beverage sector away from carbonated drinks provides opportunities for new entrants.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchases are the largest cost category
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Despite wide fluctuations in input costs such as packaging, the Juice Production industry has begun transitioning to a more economical and efficient structure via consolidating. Juice producers increasingly purchase necessary inputs, like plastic packaging materials, in bulk quantities or secure them via long-term contracts, thereby circumventing ongoing price volatility.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Despite streamlining, wages maintain their share
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Although much of the production process has become automated, low-paying jobs remain essential, and more high-skilled employees are required for research and development and marketing of new products. Streamlining operations and cost-cutting measures has improved productivity, positioning domestically produced juices to compete with other beverages and in foreign markets.

Consolidation across the industry has produced cost savings, strengthening margins. Nevertheless, volatile input prices amid the recent economy-wide disruptions authored by the COVID-19 pandemic temporarily suppressed profitability across the industry. However, margins for the industry's largest juice producers have remained higher, as companies have leveraged scale to weather challenging conditions.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: While most juice producers rely on manual labor, larger producers have adequate funding to invest in labor-saving machinery.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Low levels of innovation limit the threat to incumbent operators from new technologies disrupting their operations. However, a low rate of growth in technology can also create exposure for incumbents as the trajectory of innovation in other markets could lead to unforeseen competitive disadvantages.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Major market segments for industry operators are relatively diversified.
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Major market segments for industry operators are relatively diversified. The spread of market segments suggests that there are limited entry points other than those already served my incumbent operators.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Everchanging Consumer Preferences Constantly Challenge Juice Producers
volatility_points.volatility_description: While juices are popular, commercially produced products are often not integral to a healthy diet. In response to concerns regarding the nutritional value of certain products, producers have developed juices with natural sweeteners and low- and zero-calorie offerings. Consumers have favored juice drinks aggressively marketed as healthy, like POM brand pomegranate juice, acai juice or kombucha.

volatility_points.volatility_title: An Evolving Business Model and an Emphasis on Environmental Issues
volatility_points.volatility_description: With a higher emphasis placed on slashing production costs, many companies have begun investing in less expensive materials that are also environmentally friendly. In addition to cutting operating costs, the industry's public image has improved as environmentally conscious consumers notice and take note of changes.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in one corner of the market or do you produce a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: The industry produces products ranging from fresh juices to smoothies and fruit drinks. Small operators generally focus on one product line.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales heavily dependent on the health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: When consumers have greater disposable income, they are more likely to spend on discretionary products, like juice drinks. In contrast, consumers are prone to trading in higher priced products for less expensive beverage alternatives such as tap water to cut unnecessary expenses during economic hardships.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to volatile input prices?
FAQs.answer: Fruits and vegetables are the main ingredients in industry products. These commodities' prices are difficult to forecast, as weather patterns affect them. Industry players are also concerned with the price of sugar, plastic materials and resin, aluminum, diesel fuel and natural gas, which also exhibit volatility. Companies that successfully use strategies to hedge the risk of movements in commodity prices, including commodities derivative instruments and initiatives like preventing additional regulation of beverage manufacturers, and it provides a forum for manufacturers to discuss and defend their marketing and bottling practices.

FAQs.question: Has your company explored inorganic growth opportunities in locations with well-established infrastructure networks?
FAQs.answer: Joining forces with a larger operator or successfully integrating another business vertical can boost efficiencies in production and distribution while also improving margin and market share concentration. Optimal shelf space in retail locations is very important. A merger with a company with retail contracts would be a huge advantage.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs by automating operations?
FAQs.answer: Automation is important to maintain high and consistent levels of production daily. Companies constantly invest in tools and technology to promote operational efficiency, boost capacity, optimize supply chains and reduce overall production costs. For example, industry player Coca-Cola Consolidated Inc. has invested in a new, automated distribution center in Indiana, replacing five existing warehouses the company currently operates within the state.

FAQs.question: Does your company use ERP software systems to optimize all aspects of manufacturing, sales, inventory and distribution channels?
FAQs.answer: Tracking sales allows companies to optimize production levels, achieve a leaner level of operations and improve profitability. Bottles and gallons of juice are bulky and heavy; therefore, distribution costs are high. Establishing internal distribution networks or locking in contracts with third-part distributors may prove more profitable.

FAQs.question: Have you had any regulatory expenses that have significantly impacted profitability?
FAQs.answer: The FDA closely regulates the production of beverages for consumption and sets strict standards. The EPA also sets standards for proper waste disposal and materials used for bottling.

FAQs.question: How have international tariffs impacted your ability to import and export products? How has this affected your balance sheet?
FAQs.answer: The industry is engaged in moderate international trade and imports satisfy a relatively significant share of domestic demand. Domestic producers are protected by a certain degree of import tariffs, but these levies are likely to raise the cost of goods sold and lower company profit unless they can raise selling prices.

FAQs.question: What percentage of your company's customers renew their contracts?
FAQs.answer: Brand loyalty is important in juice products and smoothies. Consumers will continue to purchase their brand of choice despite price hikes.

FAQs.question: What steps is your company taking to support a boost in profit?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators have responded to rising health awareness by investing in healthier product lines, which typically command price premiums and generate wider margins.

FAQs.question: What alliances or relationships does your business have with other companies? How diverse is your product lineup?
FAQs.answer: Companies that produce a wide range of brands can target many different markets simultaneously, offsetting losses from one product with gains from another. This can help mitigate against falling demand in any one specific segment. Economies of scope can also help producers become more profitable by spreading total manufacturing costs over more manufacturing activities that use similar production processes.

FAQs.question: Do you cater your products to changing consumer preferences? How do you stay ahead of trends?
FAQs.answer: As consumers become more health-conscious and preferences shift away from carbonated soda and toward more natural flavored juices, companies must be prepared to supply a variety of drinks to end markets. Larger companies have responded by investing in research and development, launching new product lines or acquiring an existing company with an established brand in a niche market.

FAQs.question: Does your company have strong, established distribution channels? Do you distribute your juices internally or do you use a third-party company? How simple is it to add new partners to your distribution network?
FAQs.answer: Larger operators generally have well established, nation-wide distribution channels. Market power in the industry's distribution networks is very high and somewhat concentrated. Potential entrants must have access to these networks to survive.

FAQs.question: How does declining per capita fruit and vegetable consumption affect your company's sales?
FAQs.answer: Per capita fruit and vegetable consumption is generally on the long-term downtrend since these products are typically more expensive and consumers have increasingly satisfied daily nutritional requirements via other food groups. Consumers who eat more fruits and vegetables are more likely to buy industry products and satisfy daily fruit and vegetable intake through juice. A declining preference for fruits and vegetables may indicate falling interest in specific juices that are produced by industry players.

FAQs.question: Do you monitor the healthy eating index for use in product development? How do you expect demand for your product to fare as consumers become more health-conscious?
FAQs.answer: Increasing health awareness may benefit industry products that are all-natural or low in sugar. Accordingly, consumers have increasingly shied away from juices high in calories or containing a significant concentration of sugar or other additives.

FAQs.question: Are your products sensitive to fluctuations in per capita disposable income? What premium varieties do you offer for cash-flushed consumers?
FAQs.answer: Consumers with a greater disposable income are more likely to spend on discretionary purchases, like juice drinks. Alternatively, demand may suffer during economic hardships as cash-strapped consumers reduce purchases of nonessential items.
